result.execSummary:
The defendant Markese R. Miles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>40g), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)4.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
-------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
-------------------------------

Attend AODA counseling as recommended.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-------------------------------

** Transcript filed 9/1/16**  

3:38 pm  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Markese R. Miles in court with Atty Francis P Raff.  
Court recites charge and potential penalties.  A PSI Report is on file as well an an Addendum to the PSI.  Atty Raff has reviewed the report with his client and has no additions or corrections.  Parties have a joint recommendation with regard to sentence. 
3:40 pm  Atty Necci makes a record with regard to terms of the agreement.  
3:43 pm  Response by Atty Raff.  
3:45 pm  Defendant does not wish to make a statement.  Response by Mr. Miles to Court's question.  Mr. Miles apologizes.  
3:45 pm  Court makes its record and will adopt the joint recommendation of the parties.  

SENTENCE:  
Total length of sentence is Six (6) years;  
4 years of IC followed by 2 years of ES
99 days sentence credit (10/15/2015 - 01/22/2016)
ELIGIBLE for both CIP and SAP

Conditions of extended supervision:  
1)  No alcohol or illegal drug use / possession.  
2)  Attend AODA counseling as recommended.  
3)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
4)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  

3:49 pm  Court in recess.
Sentencing hearing on August 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
ADDENDUM to Pre-sentence Investigation
